name: Bit Crusher
description: This algorithm is an implementation of the disting mk4 algorithm of the same name. It applies sample rate and bit depth reduction to deliberately introduce quantization and aliasing artifacts. The ‘Bit reduce’ parameter sets the bit depth reduction, with two types available: Type I (discontinuous power-of-2 bit reduction) and Type II (smooth variation via integer math division). Symmetric or asymmetric bit reduction can be selected via the ‘Symmetric’ parameter. The ‘Reduction’ parameter controls independent bit reduction types for positive/negative signal sections. Additionally, the ‘Mangling’ parameter selects non-linear distortion effects like bit swaps and XOR operations. Downsampling (sample rate reduction) is controlled by the ‘Downsample’ parameter.
short_description: Sample rate and bit depth reduction
use_cases: Creating lo-fi or digital degradation effects
Adding gritty texture to audio signals
Experimental sound design with quantization artifacts
gui_description: The interface likely includes knobs/sliders for Bit reduce, Symmetric toggle, Reduction selector, Mangling selector, and Downsample control. Routing parameters (Input, Width, Output, etc.) may appear in a separate routing section.
